result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis Ryan Towne was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalty-Theft if Value <=$2500], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant's bond shall remain in effect during said Diversion Agreement.

Defendant shall file monthly written reports with the Monroe County Justice Department certifying the defendant's compliance with the conditions specified in the agreement.

The defendant shall provide any change of address information to the Monroe County Justice Department and Monroe County Clerk of Circuit Court within 24 hours of said change.

Defendant will pay a $20.00 per month Diversion Agreement fee to the Justice Program Coordinator or designee by the 5th day of each month.

Defendant shall meet in person with the Justice Program Coordinator or designee approximately every three (3) months while the Diversion Agreement is in effect.

Defendant shall appear in court at a review hearing approximately four (4) months after the Court's approval of the agreement.  The court will schedule the review hearing and send notice to the defendant at the most recent address provided to the Clerk of Court's office.

The Diversion Agreement may expire early after a period of 3 years if the Defendant has successfully completed all of the terms of probation, is doing well, and is in compliance with all conditions of the Diversion Agreement.

The Defendant shall abide by all rules of Probation & Parole.  The agreement may be revoked if the Defendant violates any rules of Probation & Parole regardless of what action Probation & Parole may take.

Defendant to comply with all other terms and conditions of this Agreement.
Pay restitution of $2,000.00 and restitution surcharge of $200.00, joint and several with co-defendant.

Complete AODA assessment and comply with any treatment recommendations.

No controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name.

No contact with W.G., R.N., K.C., S.B., C.V., B.J., A.S., J.V., B.V., J.O., P.P. and B.S. or any of their residences.

Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

DEFENDANT ENTITLED TO 60 DAYS SENTENCE CREDIT IF PROBATION IS REVOKED.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay restitution of $2,000.00 plus restitution surcharge of $200.00 jointly and severally with Andrew Sheffield.  Bond to be applied to restitution.

Defendant to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended.

No consumption or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription in defendant's own name.

No possession of drug paraphernalia.

No contact with W.G., R.N., K.C., S.B., J.V., B.V., J.O., P.P., B.S., C.V., B.J. and A.S. or any of their residences.

Comply with any conditions, no contacts and assessments ordered by agent.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
